definition: question bank (for examiners creating an exam, or students preparing for an exam)
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: This paper introduces how to design a small scale general-purpose question bank system used for examinations.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了一種小型通用試題庫系統的設計方法。

sentences.english: Online examination management system is to use ASP.
sentences.chinese: 在線題庫管理系統是利用ASP。

sentences.english: It is important to improve item bank performance with a rational item storage structure.
sentences.chinese: 合理的試題存儲結構能顯著提高題庫系統的整體性能。

sentences.english: The Final Exam must randomly draw from the pool of 1150 chapter test questions.
sentences.chinese: 期末考試必須隨機抽取1150章從試題庫。

sentences.english: Automatic test paper generation is a NP hard problem while restrictions exist.
sentences.chinese: 試題庫自動組卷問題是一個NP難題。

sentences.english: The question bank comprises two parts: motor vehicles and motorcycles .
sentences.chinese: 題庫分爲汽車類和摩托車類兩大部分。

sentences.english: Memorizing question banks for a year.
Examination bank is an important component of resource construction in modern distance education.
sentences.chinese: 題庫建設是現代遠程教育資源建設的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: In this paper, the design and implementation of full-text search engine on test repository are introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一箇中文題庫系統全文搜索引擎的設計與實現。

sentences.english: The pretest was performed by the focus group discussion.
sentences.chinese: 採用“專題小組討論”法對《題庫》進行預試驗。

sentences.english: The main functions and characteristics of engineering graphics test bank are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 論述了工程圖學試題庫的主要功能及特點。

definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
courseware (abbr. for 課程軟件|课程软件[ke4 cheng2 ruan3 jian4])
calculus/differentiation and integration/calculus of infinitesimals 微 and integrals 積|积
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
